headline: A Sketch In Time
excerpt: An artist’s fancy takes flight over the Rio Grande Valley.
content: “Flat, always flat, long expanses, big cloudy skies,” wrote illustrator alan Cober of the land that is a valley in name only. Cober’s drawings-he has also sketched the 1980 presidential campaign and the visit of Pope John Paul Ii to the United States - resurrect a neglected art form. A sketchbook enables the artist to record his impressions in both pictures and words. It is personal in a way the camera can never be. In Cober’s hands, the ancient art of the sketchbook is the perfect medium for an ancient land, one whose civilization is older than Texas.
